questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for routing and addressing?
questions.explanation: The Network Layer (Layer 3) is responsible for routing and addressing, as it determines the best path for forwarding packets between networks.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a layer in the IP model?
questions.explanation: The IP model consists of four layers: Network Access Layer, Internet Layer, Transport Layer, and Application Layer. The Session Layer is part of the OSI model, not the IP model.

questions.question: What is the primary function of the Data Link Layer (Layer 2) in the OSI model?
questions.explanation: The Data Link Layer (Layer 2) is responsible for error-free transfer of data frames between two devices on the same network.

questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model is divided into two sublayers: LLC (Logical Link Control) and MAC (Media Access Control)?
questions.explanation: The Data Link Layer (Layer 2) is divided into two sublayers: LLC (Logical Link Control) and MAC (Media Access Control).

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of the Connection-Oriented protocol in the Transport Layer (Layer 4)?
questions.explanation: Connection-Oriented protocols, such as TCP, guarantee delivery of data in the correct order, whereas Connectionless protocols, such as UDP, do not guarantee delivery.

quote.message: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
quote.author: Lewis Carroll
